content:
There are several must-see attractions in Timmins that visitors should consider experiencing during their visit. Here are some recommendations:

1. McIntyre Mine Headframe - This is an iconic landmark and a former gold mine that offers excellent views of the city's skyline. Visitors can take a guided tour and learn about the city's history and mining industry.

2. Cedar Meadows Resort - A wildlife reserve and resort which houses over 100 animals including moose, bison, and elk. Visitors can take guided tours or stay at the resort lodge.

3. Kamiskotia Snow Resort - A popular winter sports resort located just outside of Timmins. It features several ski runs, snow tubing, and snowmobiling trails.

4. Porcupine Ski Runners - A cross-country skiing and snowshoeing facility that has over 90km of trails.

5. Gillies Lake Conservation Area - A scenic park featuring walking trails, picnic areas, and a beach.

6. Timmins Museum: National Exhibition Centre - A museum featuring exhibits on the history of Timmins, including its mining industry and the life of Shania Twain.

7. Hollinger Golf Club - A scenic 18-hole golf course located on the site of the former Hollinger Mine.

These are just a few of the many attractions that Timmins has to offer. Visitors should also consider exploring the city's local restaurants, shops, and events to get a full taste of what the city has to offer.
